learningContent.title: Adding simple tables to a concept topic

lcInstruction.p: There are two elements available for creating tables in a concept topic: <simpletable> and <table>.
Use the <simpletable> element whenever you can, especially for short tables. Use the <table> element for larger tables or tables that need more complex formatting.
The elements contained in the <simpletable> element include:

stentry.p: The container element for the header row of a <simpletable> element. The <sthead> element contains the <stentry> element and is optional. There can only be one <sthead> element in a <simpletable> element.
The container element for the body rows of a <simpletable> element. The <strow> element contains the <stentry> element. A <simpletable> element can have one or more <strow> elements.

The container element for a single cell in a element. The element contains the text of a cell in the element, which should be wrapped in a

element according to best practice.

lcInstruction.p: This lesson will cover the basics of using the <simpletable> element.
Continue using the file lesson2/l_concept_images_tables_start.dita to add the <simpletable> element.

note.p: If you are using a DITA editor, some child elements of the <simpletable> element will automatically be inserted as you work through the examples.

step.cmd: Inside the <conbody> element after the <fig> element, add a <simpletable> element as shown in the following example:

stepxmp.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE concept PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Concept//EN" "concept.dtd"> <concept id="concept_images_tables"> <title>Duckling growth and development</title> <conbody> ... </fig> <simpletable> </simpletable> </conbody> </concept>

step.cmd: Inside the <simpletable> element, add the <sthead> element as shown in the following example:

stepxmp.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE concept PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Concept//EN" "concept.dtd"> <concept id="concept_images_tables"> <title>Duckling growth and development</title> <conbody> ... <simpletable> <sthead> </sthead> </simpletable> </conbody> </concept>

step.info: The <sthead> element sets up the header row of the <simpletable> element.

step.cmd: Inside the <sthead> element, add two <stentry> elements and add content to them as shown in the following example:

stepxmp.pre:
Duckling growth and development ...

Age

Milestone

 ...

step.info: The <stentry> element represents a single cell. The number of <stentry> elements inside the <sthead> element will determine how many columns will be in your <simpletable> element.

Each element you added follows the best practice of wrapping a

element around the text.

step.cmd: After the <sthead> element, add the <strow> element as shown in the following example:

stepxmp.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE concept PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA Concept//EN" "concept.dtd"> <concept id="concept_images_tables"> <title>Duckling growth and development</title> <conbody> ... </sthead> <strow> </strow> ... </conbody> </concept>

step.info: The <strow> element sets up each body row following the header row of the <simpletable> element.

step.cmd: Inside the <strow> element, add two <stentry> elements and add content to them as shown in the following example:

stepxmp.pre:
Duckling growth and development ...

7 weeks

Attempt flight for the first time

 ...

info.p: Every <strow> element and the <sthead> element should contain the same number of <stentry> elements.

step.cmd: After the first <strow> element, add two more rows to the <simpletable> element and add content to them as shown in the following example:

stepxmp.pre:
Duckling growth and development ...

12-14 weeks

Reach adult body weight

1 year

Capable of reproduction

 ...

step.info: You can add one or more <strow> elements to a <simpletable> element.
